what: 1. Number of events averted by vaccination (NAE)
title: Vaccination campaign impact
text: number events averted vaccination time tt calculated : NAEt=eA(t)VCtVEt(1−VCtVEt)NAE_t = e_{(t)} \frac{VC_t VE_t}{(1 - VC_t VE_t)} : eA(t)e_{(t)}: Number events time tt VEtVE_t: Vaccine effectiveness time tt VCtVC_t: Vaccine coverage time tt

what: 2. Number of avertable events considering an increase in final coverage (NAbE)
title: Vaccination campaign impact
text: number averted events alpha parameter time tt: NAbEt(α)=eA(t)VC(α)tVEt(1−VC(α)tVEt)NAbE_t(\alpha) = e_{(t)} \frac{VC(\alpha)_t VE_t}{(1 - VC(\alpha)_t VE_t)} : eA(t)e_{(t)}: Number events time tt VC(α)tVC(\alpha)_t: Hypothetical vaccine coverage time tt vaccine coverage increased factor alpha parameter VEtVE_t: Vaccine effectiveness time tt VC(α)tVC(\alpha)_t computed : VCt(α)=∑=1t(VCt−VCt−1)(1+αVCT)VC_t(\alpha) = \sum_{=1}^{t} (VC_t - VC_{t-1}) \left(1 + \frac{\alpha}{VC_T}\right) : VCtVC_t: Vaccine coverage time tt (VC0=0VC_0 = 0) VCt−1VC_{t-1}: Vaccine coverage time t−1t-1 α\alpha: Increase final vaccine coverage VCTVC_T: Maximum vaccine coverage observed

previous_headings: Mathematical Formulas > 3. Number Needed to Vaccinate (NNV)
title: Vaccination campaign impact
text: number needed vaccinate time tt calculated : NNVt=1RB(t)VEtNNV_t = \frac{1}{R_{B(t)} VE_t} RB(t)=eA(t)+NAEtNtR_{B(t)} = \frac{e_{(t)} + NAE_t}{N_t}, RB(t)R_{B(t)} represents rate events expected counterfactual population without vaccination program : VEtVE_t: Vaccine effectiveness time tt eA(t)e_{(t)}: Number events time tt NAEtNAE_t: Number events averted vaccination time tt NtN_t: Population risk time tt

previous_headings: Mathematical Formulas > 3. Number Needed to Vaccinate (NNV)
title: Vaccination campaign impact
text: number needed vaccinate time tt calculated : NNVt=vtNAEtNNV_t = \frac{v_t}{NAE_t} : vtv_t: Number vaccinated individuals time tt

title: Vaccination campaign impact
text: use toy data illustrate usage package: weekly coverage, incidence vaccine effectiveness provided package. Coverage data: coverage values computed considering sample size 1234 individuals. Incidence data: Vaccine effectiveness data:

title: Vaccination campaign impact
code: vaccine_effectiveness <- ve_mock_data$ve  nae <- compute_events_averted_by_vaccination(   number_of_events = incidence$events,   cumulative_coverage = coverage$cumulative_coverage,   vaccine_effectiveness = vaccine_effectiveness ) plot(nae, type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Events averted")

title: Vaccination campaign impact
code: nabe <- compute_events_avertable_by_increasing_coverage(   number_of_events = incidence$events,   cumulative_coverage = coverage$cumulative_coverage,   vaccine_coverage_increase = 0.1, # 10% increase in final coverage   vaccine_effectiveness = vaccine_effectiveness ) plot(nabe$new_vaccine_coverage, type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Vaccine coverage with 10% increase") plot(nabe$nabe, type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Events averted")

title: Vaccination campaign impact
code: sample_size <- 1234  nnv <- compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_machado(   number_of_events = incidence$events,   number_of_events_averted = nae,   population_size = sample_size,   vaccine_effectiveness = vaccine_effectiveness ) nnv #>  [1]  41.12997  29.50475  26.92473  27.41407  29.01461  27.30541  30.97586 #>  [8]  58.08314  60.58614  43.89116  93.86294 160.55538 137.54650 255.03374 #> [15] 230.88015 812.75083 511.59870 314.74289 351.58960 661.23225        NA #> [22]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [29]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [36]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [43]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [50]        NA        NA        NA

title: Vaccination campaign impact
code: nnv <- compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_tuite_fisman(   number_of_vaccinated = cumsum(coverage$number_of_vaccinated),   number_of_events_averted = nae ) nnv #>  [1]  41.12997  29.50475  26.92473  27.41407  29.01461  27.30541  30.97586 #>  [8]  58.08314  60.58614  43.89116  93.86294 160.55538 137.54650 255.03374 #> [15] 230.88015 812.75083 511.59870 314.74289 351.58960 661.23225        NA #> [22]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [29]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [36]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [43]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [50]        NA        NA        NA

title: Vaccination campaign impact
text: applied adapted version methods used Foppa et al. Machado et al. influenza vaccination impact. Foppa IM, Cheng PY, Reynolds SB, Shay DK, Carias C, Bresee JS, et al. Deaths averted influenza vaccination U.S. seasons 2005/06 2013/14. Vaccine. 2015 June 12;33(26):3003–9. Machado , Mazagatos C, Dijkstra F, Kislaya , Gherasim , McDonald SA, et al. Impact influenza vaccination programmes among elderly population primary care, Portugal, Spain Netherlands: 2015/16 2017/18 influenza seasons. Euro Surveill Bull Eur Sur Mal Transm Eur Commun Dis Bull. 2019 Nov;24(45):1900268. Tuite AR, Fisman DN. Number-needed--vaccinate calculations: fallacies associated exclusion transmission. Vaccine. 2013 Jan 30;31(6):973-8.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Yohann Mansiaux. Author, maintainer. Alexandre Blake. Author. James Humphreys. Author. Baltazar Nunes. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mansiaux Y, Blake , Humphreys J, Nunes B (2025). vaccinationimpact: Impact Study Vaccination Campaigns. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/Epiconcept-Paris/vaccinationimpact/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {vaccinationimpact: Impact Study of Vaccination Campaigns},   author = {Yohann Mansiaux and Alexandre Blake and James Humphreys and Baltazar Nunes},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/Epiconcept-Paris/vaccinationimpact/}, }

title: Impact Study of Vaccination Campaigns
text: goal vaccinationimpact assess impact vaccination campaigns using following estimates: Number events averted vaccination (NAE) Number avertable events considering increase final coverage (NAbE) Number needed vaccinate (NNV) prevent one event

title: Impact Study of Vaccination Campaigns
text: can install development version vaccinationimpact GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Epiconcept-Paris/vaccinationimpact")

title: Impact Study of Vaccination Campaigns
text: use toy data illustrate usage package: weekly coverage, incidence vaccine effectiveness provided package.
code: library(vaccinationimpact) data(coverage_and_incidence_mock_data) data(ve_mock_data) coverage <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$coverage_data incidence <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$incidence_data vaccine_effectiveness <- ve_mock_data$ve

title: Impact Study of Vaccination Campaigns
text: NNV can estimated using 2 methods: Machado et al. Tuite Fisman (see vignette details).

title: Impact Study of Vaccination Campaigns
code: sample_size <- 1234  nnv_machado <- compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_machado(   number_of_events = incidence$events,   number_of_events_averted = nae,   population_size = sample_size,   vaccine_effectiveness = vaccine_effectiveness ) nnv_machado #>  [1]  41.12997  29.50475  26.92473  27.41407  29.01461  27.30541  30.97586 #>  [8]  58.08314  60.58614  43.89116  93.86294 160.55538 137.54650 255.03374 #> [15] 230.88015 812.75083 511.59870 314.74289 351.58960 661.23225        NA #> [22]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [29]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [36]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [43]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [50]        NA        NA        NA

title: Impact Study of Vaccination Campaigns
text: information can found vignette.
code: nnv_tuite_fisman <- compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_tuite_fisman(   number_of_vaccinated = cumsum(coverage$number_of_vaccinated),   number_of_events_averted = nae ) nnv_tuite_fisman #>  [1]  41.12997  29.50475  26.92473  27.41407  29.01461  27.30541  30.97586 #>  [8]  58.08314  60.58614  43.89116  93.86294 160.55538 137.54650 255.03374 #> [15] 230.88015 812.75083 511.59870 314.74289 351.58960 661.23225        NA #> [22]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [29]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [36]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [43]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [50]        NA        NA        NA

title: Impact Study of Vaccination Campaigns
text: package developed conduct impact study COVID-19 vaccination part VEBIS project funded ECDC.

title: Compute events averted by increasing the final vaccine coverage — compute_events_avertable_by_increasing_coverage
text: Compute events averted increasing final vaccine coverage

title: Compute events averted by increasing the final vaccine coverage — compute_events_avertable_by_increasing_coverage
code: compute_events_avertable_by_increasing_coverage(   number_of_events,   cumulative_coverage,   vaccine_coverage_increase,   vaccine_effectiveness )

title: Compute events averted by increasing the final vaccine coverage — compute_events_avertable_by_increasing_coverage
text: number_of_events number events cumulative_coverage cumulative vaccination coverage vaccine_coverage_increase percentage increase final vaccine coverage (0 1) vaccine_effectiveness vaccine effectiveness

title: Compute events averted by increasing the final vaccine coverage — compute_events_avertable_by_increasing_coverage
text: list new vaccine coverage ("new_vaccine_coverage") estimated number events averted ("nabe")

title: Compute events averted by increasing the final vaccine coverage — compute_events_avertable_by_increasing_coverage
code: data(coverage_and_incidence_mock_data) data(ve_mock_data) coverage <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$coverage_data incidence <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$incidence_data vaccine_effectiveness <- ve_mock_data$ve nabe <- compute_events_avertable_by_increasing_coverage(   number_of_events = incidence$events,   cumulative_coverage = coverage$cumulative_coverage,   vaccine_coverage_increase = 0.1, # 10% increase in final coverage   vaccine_effectiveness = vaccine_effectiveness ) plot(nabe$new_vaccine_coverage, type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Vaccine coverage with 10% increase")  plot(nabe$nabe, type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Events averted")

title: Compute events averted by vaccination — compute_events_averted_by_vaccination
text: number_of_events number events cumulative_coverage cumulative vaccination coverage vaccine_effectiveness vaccine effectiveness

text: estimated number events averted

title: Compute events averted by vaccination — compute_events_averted_by_vaccination
text: number events averted vaccination calculated described Machado et al. (2019) doi:10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2019.24.45.1900268.

title: Compute events averted by vaccination — compute_events_averted_by_vaccination
code: data(coverage_and_incidence_mock_data) data(ve_mock_data) coverage <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$coverage_data incidence <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$incidence_data vaccine_effectiveness <- ve_mock_data$ve nae <- compute_events_averted_by_vaccination(   number_of_events = incidence$events,   cumulative_coverage = coverage$cumulative_coverage,   vaccine_effectiveness = vaccine_effectiveness ) plot(nae, type = "l", xlab = "Time", ylab = "Events averted")

title: Compute the number of individuals needed to vaccinate to prevent one event according to Machado et al. method — compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_machado
text: number individuals needed vaccinate avert one event

title: Compute the number of individuals needed to vaccinate to prevent one event according to Machado et al. method — compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_machado
text: number individuals needed vaccinate prevent one event calculated described Machado et al. (2019) doi:10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2019.24.45.1900268.

title: Compute the number of individuals needed to vaccinate to prevent one event according to Machado et al. method — compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_machado
code: data(coverage_and_incidence_mock_data) data(ve_mock_data) coverage <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$coverage_data incidence <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$incidence_data vaccine_effectiveness <- ve_mock_data$ve nae <- compute_events_averted_by_vaccination(   number_of_events = incidence$events,   cumulative_coverage = coverage$cumulative_coverage,   vaccine_effectiveness = vaccine_effectiveness ) nnv_machado <- compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_machado(   number_of_events = incidence$events,   number_of_events_averted = nae,   population_size = 1234,   vaccine_effectiveness = vaccine_effectiveness ) nnv_machado #>  [1]  41.12997  29.50475  26.92473  27.41407  29.01461  27.30541  30.97586 #>  [8]  58.08314  60.58614  43.89116  93.86294 160.55538 137.54650 255.03374 #> [15] 230.88015 812.75083 511.59870 314.74289 351.58960 661.23225        NA #> [22]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [29]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [36]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [43]        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA #> [50]        NA        NA        NA

title: Compute the number of individuals needed to vaccinate to prevent one event according to Tuite and Fisman method — compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_tuite_fisman

text: number individuals needed vaccinate avert one event

title: Compute the number of individuals needed to vaccinate to prevent one event according to Tuite and Fisman method — compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_tuite_fisman
text: number individuals needed vaccinate prevent one event calculated described Tuite Fisman (2013) doi:10.1016/j.vaccine.2012.11.097.

title: Compute the number of individuals needed to vaccinate to prevent one event according to Tuite and Fisman method — compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_tuite_fisman
code: data(coverage_and_incidence_mock_data) data(ve_mock_data) coverage <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$coverage_data incidence <- coverage_and_incidence_mock_data$incidence_data vaccine_effectiveness <- ve_mock_data$ve nae <- compute_events_averted_by_vaccination(   number_of_events = incidence$events,   cumulative_coverage = coverage$cumulative_coverage,   vaccine_effectiveness = vaccine_effectiveness ) nnv_tuite_fisman <- compute_number_needed_to_vaccinate_tuite_fisman(   number_of_vaccinated = coverage$number_of_vaccinated,   number_of_events_averted = nae ) nnv_tuite_fisman #>  [1] 41.1299696 18.3214994  9.4447994  7.4670700  5.5074023  2.6277170 #>  [7]  2.6109923  4.0057337  2.6850674  1.3534720  2.5150842  2.5404332 #> [13]  1.7193312  2.1077169  1.1864345  4.1551679  1.5645220  0.6403721 #> [19]  0.3573065  0.6713018         NA         NA         NA         NA #> [25]         NA         NA         NA         NA         NA         NA #> [31]         NA         NA         NA         NA         NA         NA #> [37]         NA         NA         NA         NA         NA         NA #> [43]         NA         NA         NA         NA         NA         NA #> [49]         NA         NA         NA         NA
